subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology
subSections.text: Boodberg (1980) proposes a connection with {{och-l|[[王]]}} "king" (see there for more information).

subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=6|rs=白04}}

# [[emperor]]

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|すべ}}
* The pitch accent is determined by the entire prefixed term.

subSections.title: Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|すべ}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=すべ}} ''prefix expressing [[praise]] and [[respect]], usually towards [[Shinto]] [[deity|deities]] or the Emperor of Japan''
## [[divine]], [[godly]], [[heavenly]]
## [[imperial]], [[royal]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|皇神|すべがみ|rom=subekami, subegami}}

Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|すべら}}

From the prefix {{m|ja||皇|tr=sube-|pos=see above}} + {{m|ja|等|tr=-ra|pos=nominalizing and pluralizing suffix}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|すべらぎ}}

From {{m|ja|天皇|tr=suberagi|pos=archaic term for the Emperor of Japan, literally "[[heavenly]] [[sovereign]]"}}, without the connotation of "divine, godly, heavenly". Found mainly in compounds. {{rfv-etymology|ja}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|すべらぎ}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|すべらぎ}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=すべらぎ}} a form of [[title]] or [[address]] to a person highest in rank {{gloss|akin to the Emperor of Japan}} {{rfv-sense|ja}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
